I see your planes and raise you a [Lambda-class T-4a shuttle](http://starwars.wikia.com/wiki/Lambda-class_T-4a_shuttle)

Somehow this thing is flyable after it drops off the runway... no sas, 100% stock, pita to fly smoothly (joysticks are a blessing)

![bH9Jv.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/bH9Jv.jpg)

No so much, but fast ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Hey.. do you have problem with fly controls on speed above 350-400m\s?
That\'ll be the height I think. The air gets thinner the higher you go so lifting surfaces and control surfaces become less effective.

So, while it may not be the smallest, I thought I\'d add this one to the list because it\'s (slightly) different from anyone elses.\*

Originally had 3 landing gear. Dropped them the moment i was airborne (the small drop at the end of the runway is what allowed me to get into the air \*cough\*)

Mini-Jet, powered by RCS thrusters! A micro-jet with micro-engines! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

All stock parts. Only 1 RCS tank, noticable by the fact it took most the fuel just to get to the end of the runway, and into the air :|

It\'s not exactly classified as a \'long-range\' aircraft.

didn\'t seem \*too\* hard to fly once in the air. the main difficulty for me is that you cannot let go of the Thrust-forward button. Throttle obviously having no effect here.

\*: it\'s 5 am, and there\'s a good chance i missed one, two, all of the posts in this thread XD but apparently awake enough to design a spaceplane... But I guess it\'s never a bad time to make space vehicles on Kerbin.
